page.title: 11PRIORY FARM,BY RICHARD SWIFT
page.content: MR SWIFT OWNS A SMALL FARM OF ABOUT 48 ACRES.HE ALSO RENTS 2 ONE ACRE FIELDS. HE GROWS POTATOES,CABBAGES,SWEET CORN,LEEKS,BROCCOLI AND FRENCH BEANS.MR AND MRS SWIFT RUN A FARM SHOP IN A BARN WHICH IS ABOUT 250 YEARS OLD.THEY SELL FRUIT,VEGETABLES,HONEY, EGGS,SWEETS AND DRINKS.THE SHOP IS OPPOSITE PRIORY FARM ON THE BRADFIELD TO RAMSEY ROAD.THE SHOP OPENS FROM 9am TO 6pm ON WEEK DAYS AND FROM 10am TO 1pm ON SUNDAYS.THE BUSIEST DAY OF THE WEEK IS SATURDAY AND THE BUSIEST TIME IS THE SUMMER.MR SWIFT HAS TWO PEOPLE WORKING IN THE SHOP;EACH WORKS 2\ DAYS A WEEK.THE MOST POPULAR THING THE SHOP SELLS IS POTATOES.THE POTATOES ARE SORTED AND GRADED ON A RIDDLE WHICH SORTS 2 TONS AN HOUR.MR.SWIFT HAS A SPECIAL LOGO OF A BIRD (A SWIFT!) WHICH APPEARS ON ALL HIS BAGS OF POTATOES.
